item.title: KarthVader - Core Data Wrapper in Swift
Communication between Apple Watch with new WatchOS-2 and iPhone
item.description: In Watch OS 2, apple moved the watch extension bundle & data source to watch itself, previously it was in iPhone only. No more openParentApplication: api call, CFNotificationCenterGetDarwinNotifyCenter & sharedGroups. Apple itself given new framework for all sorts of communication named WatchConnectivity, supports for NSURLSession & codedata.

item.title: How do we communicate between Watch and iPhone App ?
item.description: Apple Watch uses Wi-Fi and Bluetooth to communicate with your paired iPhone, switching between connections as needed:

item.title: Symbolicating crashes now made easy
item.description:
About dSYM

If you have issues with symbolicating crashes in iOS by dragging the .crash file into the organiser tab, there is a symbolicatecrash.pl script provide by Xcode as well as atos tool to symbolicate the crash and a memory reference respectively. The script allows us to symbolicate the whole crash file where as using atos we can symbolicate single memory reference.

item.title: Possible abuse of dispatch_after
item.description: I often come across code which uses dispatchafter GCD API to fire some process when an animation completes. I often feel this an abuse on using **dispatchafter** API. I would more like to use callbacks which notifies the completion of animation.

item.title: Shaping up with CAShapeLayer
item.description: What out stands iOS mobile platform from others is the power of animations. For animations iOS provides several classes with animatable properties that makes animations look easier. However some animations like the Apple's application circular loader, there are no special classes that readily available for animation.

item.title: Draw a Bezier Curve through a set of 2D Points in iOS
item.description: We got this issue couple of days back where we needed to smooth a line graph like below. It seemed strange that this was not as trivial by the Bezier methods provided by Core Graphics. So we embarked on a journey to find a generic solution.

item.title: Lets Roll!
item.description: Welcome to YMediaLabs Engineering blog! This is a public forum where we share the latest things we work on. Somethings we think is good to share with the world. Fun things, interesting things and some amazing code.
